docstr: `GAMMA` — Gamma function ### Description `GAMMA(X)` computes Gamma (\Gamma) of `X`. For positive, integer values of `X` the Gamma function simplifies to the factorial function \Gamma(x)=(x-1)!. ### Syntax `X = GAMMA(X)` ### Arguments and neither zero nor a negative integer. ### Return value The return value is of type `REAL` of the same kind as `X`. ### Example ``` program test_gamma   real :: x = 1.0   x = gamma(x) ! returns 1.0 end program test_gamma ``` ### Specific names | Name | Argument | Return type | Standard | `GAMMA(X)` | `REAL(4) X` | `REAL(4)` | GNU Extension | `DGAMMA(X)` | `REAL(8) X` | `REAL(8)` | GNU Extension ### Standard Fortran 2008 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also Logarithm of the Gamma function: LOG_GAMMA
